00010 // macro to read the file (used in the config constructor from file)
00011 // 'test' is a string used to parse the file (IMPORTANT: it has to be defined outside)
00012 // 'is' is the input stream of the file
00013 // 'var' is the name of the variable (in the c++ code), and 'nameinfile' its identifient in the script file
00014 // 'scopeerrmsg' is a string ("...") used in the error management and should correspond to the class in which the macro is used
00016 
00017 #define READ_FROM_FILE(filestream, var, nameinfile, scopeerrmsg)                                                                    \
00018     if (filestream.eof())                                                                                                       \
00019         throw ConfigError(std::string(scopeerrmsg) + ": unexpected end of file, expected '" + nameinfile );                         \
00020     filestream >> test;                                                                                                         \
00021     if (test == nameinfile)                                                                                                     \
00022         if (filestream.eof())                                                                                                   \
00023             throw ConfigError(std::string(scopeerrmsg) + ": unexpected end of file, expected the value of " + nameinfile );     \
00024         else                                                                                                                    \
00025             filestream >> var;                                                                                                  \
00026     else                                                                                                                        \
00027         throw ConfigError(std::string(scopeerrmsg) + ": expected '" + nameinfile + "', got '" + test + "'");

00033 // macro to automate the creation of the neuron classes
00035 
00036 #define NEURON_TYPE(name, data, act_mech)                                   \
00037     \
00038     typedef NeuronTemplate<data, act_mech, NeuronInterface> name;               \
00039     \
00040     template <>                                                                 \
00041     struct NeuronTypeMap<data, act_mech>                                        \
00042     {                                                                           \
00043         typedef name created_type;                                              \
00044     };

00070 // macro to make a class visitable
00072 
00073 #define MAKE_VISITABLE(name)                                        \
00074     \
00075     void apply_vis(AbstractVisitor & vis)                               \
00076     {                                                                   \
00077         Visitor<name > * ptvis = dynamic_cast<Visitor<name > *>(& vis); \
00078         if (ptvis)                                                      \
00079             ptvis->visit(*this);                                        \
00080     }
